<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 277, 232, 293]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 344]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 490, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 559, 482, 574]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 574, 885, 604]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 604, 860, 634]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 215, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 787, 92]]<|/det|>
Expand \((1 + 3x)^6\) in ascending powers of \(x\) up to, and including, the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 510, 744, 529]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((1 - 7x + x^{2})(1 + 3x)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 881, 92]]<|/det|>
A line has equation \(y = 2cx + 3\) and a curve has equation \(y = cx^2 + 3x - c\), where \(c\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 816, 123]]<|/det|>
Showing all necessary working, determine which of the following statements is correct.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 138, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 135, 695, 153]]<|/det|>
The line and curve intersect only for a particular set of values of \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 160, 136, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 160, 537, 178]]<|/det|>
The line and curve intersect for all values of \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 184, 136, 202]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 183, 603, 201]]<|/det|>
The line and curve do not intersect for any values of \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 82, 650, 227]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 250, 920, 300]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a cubical closed container made of a thin elastic material which is filled with water and frozen. During the freezing process the length, \(x \text{cm}\), of each edge of the container increases at the constant rate of \(0.01 \text{cm per minute.}\) The volume of the container at time \(t\) minutes is \(V \text{cm}^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 312, 138, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 312, 462, 330]]<|/det|>
Find the rate of increase of \(V\) when \(x = 20\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 312, 917, 330]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The transformation R denotes a reflection in the \(x\)-axis and the transformation T denotes a translation of \(\left( \begin{array}{c}3\\ - 1 \end{array} \right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
Find the equation, \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\), of the curve with equation \(y = x^{2}\) after it has been transformed by the sequence of transformations R followed by T.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 395, 144, 413]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 395, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
Find the equation, \(y = \mathrm{h}(x)\), of the curve with equation \(y = x^{2}\) after it has been transformed by the sequence of transformations T followed by R.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 411, 920, 428]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 687, 144, 704]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 687, 816, 704]]<|/det|>
State fully the transformation that maps the curve \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) onto the curve \(y = \mathrm{h}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 686, 920, 704]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 84, 640, 268]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 288, 920, 339]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a motif formed by the major arc \(AB\) of a circle with radius \(r\) and centre \(O\), and the minor arc \(AOB\) of a circle, also with radius \(r\) but with centre \(C\). The point \(C\) lies on the circle with centre \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 351, 146, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 351, 698, 370]]<|/det|>
Given that angle \(ACB = k\pi\) radians, state the value of the fraction \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 352, 920, 370]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 626, 143, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 626, 626, 644]]<|/det|>
State the perimeter of the shaded motif in terms of \(\pi\) and \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 626, 920, 644]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 771, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded motif, giving your answer in terms of \(\pi\), \(r\) and \(\sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The sum of the first two terms of a geometric progression is 15 and the sum to infinity is \(\frac{125}{7}\). The common ratio of the progression is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 425, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the third term of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 484, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 390, 92]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{gf}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 312, 601, 333]]<|/det|>
The function h is defined by \(\mathrm{h}(x) = 4x^{2} - 12x + 13\) for \(x < 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 346, 148, 365]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 346, 400, 365]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{h}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 346, 920, 365]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 662, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(A\), giving each coordinate in surd form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 675, 186, 692]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 675, 920, 710]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent at \(A\), giving the answer in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(c\) is in surd form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 692, 920, 710]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
